intro: Epilobium howellii, commonly known as Howell's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as streambanks and meadows. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Epilobium howellii is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
